STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 25, 2020
Alison Morrison
Gratiot County DHHS
201 Commerce Drive
Ithaca, MI 48847
RE: License #: CP290201154
Gratiot County DHHS
201 Commerce Drive
Ithaca, MI 48847
Dear Ms. Morrison:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 11/25/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the
department's licensing authority within 5 working days in
the manner prescribed by the department.
One of the two special evaluations reviewed indicated the record was not submitted
within the time frame established by this rule. In this example the intake date
was7/31/2020 and the information was not submitted to the department’s licensing
authority until 08/220/2020. The information was logged into the information system
on 08/03/2020 and the evaluation was also initiated within that time. The delay in
the submission to the licensing authority was due to a medical emergency for the
supervisor. The information was submitted upon the supervisor’s return.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of
the following information:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names shall not be included in the
report.
One of the two special evaluations reviewed contained the last name of a foster child
that was placed in the home. This occurred in one location within the report and was
due to the information system automatically migrating that information into the report
from another location within the information system, and the worker did not delete
the last name during their review of the evaluation report.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary, then all
of the documentation required in subrules (2) and (3) of this rule
shall be in the child's record within 14 calendar days after the
change in placement.
4

One of the two discharged youth did not have the documentation completed/located
in the information system within the time frame established by this rule. The youth
had an identified discharge date of 02/18/2020 and the form to document this
information was dated 11/24/2020. This is a repeat noncompliance from the
renewal evaluation completed 06/14/2019.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
One of the six current foster child records reviewed contained an initial service plan
that was completed outside the time frame established by this rule. In this example
the initial service plan for the time period 08/21/2020 to 09/19/2020 was completed
09/23/2020.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 6.49 – Page 34 Medical Passports (Commitment 85).
(a) At the time the child is placed or re-placed, the foster care provider shall
receive the child’s Medical Passport, which must contain the information
required by MCL 722.954c(2) and DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or
any successor policies approved by the Monitors). And at least quarterly
thereafter, updated Medical Passport must be prepared, as required by the
“Medical Passports” section of DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or
any successor policy approved by the Monitors), and provided to the foster
care provider.
Two of the six current foster child records reviewed did not include updated
medical passports in the system with signatures to indicate they were provided to
the foster care provider.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
5

Analyst Findings
There were no safety alerts.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
This evaluation was completed on a home belonging to another certifying agency. A
corrective action plan was required. A corrective action plan was implemented and
is to be completed by 01/15/2021.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the renewal
evaluation completed 06/14/2019. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of
that evaluation were R 400.12327 (6)(c) (7), R 400.12405 (4), R 400.12418 (2)(b),
ISEP 6.33(c), ISEP 4.22, DHHS Policy FOM 722-09, DHHS Policy FOM 722-08, and
DHHS Policy FOM 801. The only repeat citation as a part of this interim evaluation
is R 400.12405 (4).
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
11/25/2020
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 9, 2020
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
